meanings.definition: A vegetable with a long white bulb and long green leaves.
meanings.sent1: I planted a leek in my garden.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a leek in the soup.
meanings.sent3: Why did the leek refuse to play hide and seek? Because it was always visible!
meanings.sent4: The leek stood tall in the garden, a beacon of freshness.
meanings.sent5: The crisp crunch of a leek is a delight in every bite.

meanings.definition: To leak or allow fluid to escape.
meanings.sent1: The faucet started to leek, causing a small puddle.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to let the water leek out of the container.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cupcake batter leek out of the pan? It wanted to explore the oven!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to leek tears of joy at the heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent5: The dam was unable to contain the water, causing it to leek through the cracks.
